Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Obama "directed his supporters in Colorado to engage in a little all-American voter fraud," when there is no evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that President Obama directed voter fraud.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the email from John Podesta referenced in the WikiLeaks archive proves that President Obama directed voter fraud, but there is no direct evidence to support this assumption.
Misinterpretation: The claim misinterprets the content of the WikiLeaks documents by attributing the phrase "a little all-American voter fraud" to an email that does not contain such wording.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no email from John Podesta stating that President Obama directed voter fraud.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the content of the email, such as discussing concerns about ineligible voters in the 2016 Democratic caucuses in Colorado.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a blog post about the WikiLeaks documents rather than the actual text of the released documents.
